item.title: TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 tickets now on sale: Lowest rates all year
item.dc:creator: TechCrunch Events
item.description: TechCrunch Disrupt 2026 tickets are officially on sale. Save up to $680 on your ticket and be among the first 500 registrants to score a plus-one pass at 50% off. Don't miss 10,000 tech leaders, founders, and VCs in San Francisco from October 13-15. Register before these one-time deals vanish.

item.title: PraxisPro raises $6M seed from AlleyCorp to coach medical sales reps
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: PraxisPro, founded by a former pharma sales rep, offers small language model AI training specifically designed for medical product sales.

item.title: Language learning marketplace Preply’s unicorn status embodies Ukrainian resilience
item.dc:creator: Anna Heim
item.description: Language learning marketplace Preply is now valued at $1.2 billion after raising a $150 million that marks a new chapter for the 14-year-old company.

item.title: Retail startup Another raises a $2.5M seed to help sell excess inventory
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: Another hopes to help companies address excess inventory before brands opt to sell items to bulk resellers. Corina Marshall, Another's founder, says items sold through such resellers may be deeply discounted, an outcome brands might not want.

item.title: Grubhub parent acquires restaurant rewards startup Claim
item.dc:creator: Aisha Malik
item.description: The acquisition will give restaurants on Grubhub access to Claim’s customer acquisition and retention tools, while Grubhub diners can receive rewards.

item.title: Humans&, a ‘human-centric’ AI startup founded by Anthropic, xAI, Google alums, raised $480M seed round
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Humans&, a startup that believes AI should empower people, not replace them, has reportedly raised a $480 million seed round at a $4.48 billion valuation.

item.title: Eat App wants a bite of India’s restaurant reservation business with an acquisition and Swiggy partnership
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Eat App is making India its central focus to market its reservation and dine-in growth suite.

item.title: Indian vibe-coding startup Emergent triples valuation to $300M with $70M fundraise
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The funding comes as the startup claims it has scaled ARR to $50 million and is targeting $100 million by April 2026.

item.title: Everstone combines Wingify and ABTasty for $100M+ digital experience optimization platform
item.dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
item.description: The combined business will serve more than 4,000 customers globally and surpass $100 million in annual revenue.

item.title: Here are the 55 US AI startups that raised $100M or more in 2025
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Last year was monumental for the AI industry in the U.S. and beyond. How will 2025 compare?

item.title: Rogue agents and shadow AI: Why VCs are betting big on AI security
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Misaligned agents are just one layer of the AI security challenge that startup Witness AI is trying to solve. It detects employee use of unapproved tools, blocks attacks, and ensures compliance.

item.title: Looking ahead to 2026: What’s next for Startup Battlefield 200
item.dc:creator: Isabelle Johannessen
item.description: See what to expect for Startup Battlefield 200 in 2026, the ultimate startup pitch competition on the global stage at TechCrunch Disrupt. Join the mailing list to be the first to know when applications drop.

item.title: BioticsAI, which won Disrupt’s Battlefield competition in 2023, gains FDA approval for its AI-powered fetal ultrasound product
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: TechCrunch Disrupt Battlefield 2023 winner BioticsAI announced on Monday that it has received FDA clearance for its AI software that helps detect fetal abnormalities in ultrasound images.

item.title: How YC-backed Bucket Robotics survived its first CES
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description: Now, the startup is turning its attention to building the business, fundraising, and striking commercial deals.

item.title: AI cloud startup Runpod hits $120M in ARR — and it started with a Reddit post
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Their startup journey is a wild example of how if you build it well and the timing is lucky, they will definitely come.

item.title: Snowflake, Databricks challenger ClickHouse hits $15B valuation
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The $400 million round was led by Dragoneer.

item.title: The AI healthcare gold rush is here
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: AI companies are clustering around healthcare and fast.  In just the past week, OpenAI bought health startup Torch, Anthropic launched Claude for healthcare, and Sam Altman-backed MergeLabs closed a $250 million seed round at an $850 million valuation. The money and products are pouring into health and voice AI, but so are concerns about hallucination risks, inaccurate medical information, and […]

item.title: The rise of ‘micro’ apps: non-developers are writing apps instead of buying them
item.dc:creator: Dominic-Madori Davis
item.description: A new era of app creation is here. It's fun, it's fast, and it's fleeting.

item.title: AI journalism startup Symbolic.ai signs deal with Rupert Murdoch’s News Corp
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: The startup claims its AI platform can help optimize editorial processes and research.

item.title: AI video startup, Higgsfield, founded by ex-Snap exec, lands $1.3B valuation
item.dc:creator: Julie Bort
item.description: Higgsfield says it's on a $200 million annual revenue run rate. So it opened its previous Series A round back up and sold another $80 million in shares.
